content: a fun quick cable project by black squirrel yarns shop owner maia discoe that can be made in any weight of yarn up to an aran weight heavy yarns make the cable crossing very difficult pick a yarn that is not overly drapey this scarf benefits from a yarn with some structure it can easily be made with one skein even a 50g skein if it is a thinner yarn each version shown uses one skein this is a perfect project for a special skein or as a stash buster it can be worn as a scarf headband or belt difficulty level advanced beginner skills required are increasing decreasing and cabling notions removable stitch markers 3 tapestry needle and a cable needle or dpn see notes at beginning of pattern instructions gauge gauge is not critical the scarf can be worked as long as you like or until you run out of yarn the versions shown are as long as they can be using one skein yarn & needle teal version the fibre co road to china light 65% alpaca / 15% silk / 10% camel / 10% cashmere in lapis 159 yards 145 meters per 50g skein 1 skein us4 3 25mm pink version kelbourne woolens scout 100% wool in rosewood heather 274 yards 250 meters per 100g skein 1 skein us6 4 0 mm green version &make aran 50% highland wool / 50% alpaca in mon ami 164 yards 150 meters per 100g skein 1 skein us8 5 0 mm
